{{DISPLAYTITLE:<samp>blocks-atlas</samp>}}
{{Outdated feature|edition=je}}
{{more images|Figure out a way to obtain versions of this from 13w18a to 13w37b}}
[[File:14w17a blocks-atlas.png|thumb|blocks-atlas in [[14w21b]], the last version to use this file.]]

'''<samp>blocks-atlas</samp>''' was a [[texture atlas]] used by the game to store textures for [[block]]s and [[fluid]]s, following the deprecation of <samp>[[terrain.png]]</samp>

It was eventually merged with <samp>[[items-atlas]]</samp> to form <samp>[[textures-atlas]]</samp>.

|{{HistoryLine||1.7.2|dev=13w41a|<samp>blocks-atlas</samp> and its dimensions are now announced in the game log when loading the game and when changing resource packs.}}
|{{HistoryLine||1.8|dev=14w25a|<samp>blocks-atlas</samp> has been merged with <samp>items-atlas</samp> to create <samp>[[textures-atlas]]</samp>.}}
}}

==== Anisotropic Filtering ====
When toggled on, this option would add eight pixels to the edge of each texture, taken from the other side. This results in atlases which look considerably different, and with different dimensions.

==== Mipmapped versions ====
Up to four mipmapped versions of each atlas would also be generated by the game from 13w38a onwards, depending on the current values in Video Settings. The textures would be shrunk to 8&times;8, 4&times;4, 2&times;2 and 1&times;1, and would render instead of the normal textures at far distances or sharp angles of incidence.
